710139f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 28th Street
710139f-a.text:
Ei-hth Avenue, east side, north from 28th to 30th Streets. Eliminated at t:.e right are buildings numbered 362-364 and 366 Eighth Avenue, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of 28th Street. The last of these appears partially on ihe margin. Note the Revillon Freres storage plant at the S.E. corner of 30th Strect. This replaced four low Avenue buildings that bore No's 392 to 398 inclusive and seve:al adjoining structures of
30th Street.
June 25, 1928
P. L. Sperr

711892f-a.title: Manhattan: 28th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
711892f-a.text:
257-259 West 28th Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Eighth Ave. Building concerned is a frame house.
About 1914.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 129.
(3)
A more inclusive view, east from the Avenue and showing across
the roof tops, the Empire State Building.
March 21, 1938.

356 to 348 Eighnth Avenue, at adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of West 28th Street (left), showing mainly the two frame (No's. 356--358) distinctive buildings. View No. 2 shows these solely and is of slightly
